name: places/ChIJoTZGw67GhkcREy4aECdOf6s
formattedAddress: P.za del Duomo, 20122 Milano MI, Italy

plusCode.compoundCode: F57R+JQ Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

adrFormatAddress: P.za del Duomo, 20122 Milano MI, Italy
shortFormattedAddress: Milan Cathedral, P.za del Duomo, Milano

editorialSummary.text: One of the largest cathedrals in the world, this iconic masterpiece took over 600 years to complete.

text.text:
Very scenic and picturesque everywhere. I went there three times and the best views were early in the morning when it was just me and someone else.
Pictures look so much better early in the morning when no one is around. As a group, we did a tour. Great views from the rooftop and while inside.

originalText.text:
Very scenic and picturesque everywhere. I went there three times and the best views were early in the morning when it was just me and someone else.
Pictures look so much better early in the morning when no one is around. As a group, we did a tour. Great views from the rooftop and while inside.

text.text: We thought we'd seen it all, but the further north we went it just got more jaw dropping. This cathedral is from the Roman Gothic architecture times for anyone that knows what that means. This cathedral's architecture is breathtaking. Left is speechless. Just shows how these genius architects thought hundreds of years ago. The Renaissance era that followed is just as good, but Gothic omg. A must see if in Milan.

originalText.text: We thought we'd seen it all, but the further north we went it just got more jaw dropping. This cathedral is from the Roman Gothic architecture times for anyone that knows what that means. This cathedral's architecture is breathtaking. Left is speechless. Just shows how these genius architects thought hundreds of years ago. The Renaissance era that followed is just as good, but Gothic omg. A must see if in Milan.

text.text: Wow... The cathedral in Milan makes an amazing impression on me. It looks majestic from the outside.  It's a really big piece of history. To go inside and to the roofs of the cathedral, from which is a beautiful view of the city, I recommend to buy a ticket in advance online for about €17, and coming early in the morning because there are not crowds of tourists yet.

originalText.text: Wow... The cathedral in Milan makes an amazing impression on me. It looks majestic from the outside.  It's a really big piece of history. To go inside and to the roofs of the cathedral, from which is a beautiful view of the city, I recommend to buy a ticket in advance online for about €17, and coming early in the morning because there are not crowds of tourists yet.

text.text:
Visiting Milan Duomo with my family, including two kids, was an overall okay experience, but a few aspects left us with mixed feelings.
The cathedral itself is a breathtaking masterpiece, with its intricate architecture and stunning design. Our kids were fascinated by the grandeur of the exterior and the history behind this iconic landmark. However, our enthusiasm was somewhat dampened by the extensive security measures at the entrance. While safety is undoubtedly important, the level of scrutiny felt exaggerated, making the entry process a bit tedious, especially with children in tow.
One major downside during our visit was the ongoing renovation work. It impacted the overall ambiance and obstructed some of the views, diminishing the full splendor of this historical site.
Additionally, the cost of going up in the tower with the elevator was a bit steep (17 EUR / person if I remember correctly). We opted to skip the tower ascent due to the high cost, which was disappointing considering it's one of the main attractions.
On a positive note, the interior of the cathedral was awe-inspiring, and exploring the surrounding square was a delightful experience. The vibrant atmosphere and surrounding shops and cafes added to the charm of the visit.
In conclusion, Milan Duomo is undoubtedly a must-visit, but potential visitors should be aware of the renovation work and be prepared for the associated challenges. The security measures could be more streamlined, and the pricing for additional experiences like the tower ascent may need reconsideration, particularly for families with children.

The security measures could be more streamlined, and the pricing for additional experiences like the tower ascent may need reconsideration, particularly for families with children.

text.text: Inside and out, beautiful! Well worth the visit! Blessed that we had a sunny day when we went up to the rooftop! Undergoing some work so quite a bit of scaffolding and builders making some noise but otherwise a great experience - even in early January!

originalText.text: Inside and out, beautiful! Well worth the visit! Blessed that we had a sunny day when we went up to the rooftop! Undergoing some work so quite a bit of scaffolding and builders making some noise but otherwise a great experience - even in early January!

name: places/ChIJE1xhrevHhkcREd5Hzm0MtVM

adrFormatAddress: Via Torino, 45, 20123 Milano MI, Italy

editorialSummary.text: Discount fashion chain offering clothes and accessories for all ages, plus homewares.

text.text:
Amazing place to shop in Milan.
A lot of choices, the shop has 4 floor.

Good prices and quality. Truly enjoyed shopping here.

originalText.text:
Amazing place to shop in Milan.
A lot of choices, the shop has 4 floor.

Good prices and quality. Truly enjoyed shopping here.

text.text:
I loved this place to shop.
You can find many things and at very good prices.

They have clothes, sports, things for your house and decoration, shoes. Different lines for women, men, kids, house, shoes.

All stuffs were made of very good quality.  I didn't buy clothes, well I did buy a souvenir sweatshirt and also souvenir things and shoes.

I think it is excellent quality vs prices that are really very very low.

They have a lot of Disney licensed stuff, so your eyes go to everything and you want everything. Obviously I bought a lot of things.

They have a good service Beacuse have a lot of shopping desk, and one day I bought a blanket and the next I need a change, they change it without problem.

The only point that I give them very bad is their super low quality paper bags.  They break at first.  and it really is pure garbage that is useless.  All the streets of the center of Milano are full of their bags because they are useless.
Really do something because this bags produce a lot of pollution and it's money in the trash and for us doesn’t work.

text.text:
Awful, shameful, and disrespectful!
Very poor quality clothes!
Too bad experience: When existing without buying anything, one so called security man stopped me and asked to  see inside of my backpack. He even didn't know basic English. Even after seeing inside of backpack, he didn't apologize for wrongfully asking to see inside my backpack.
Never had such a unpleasant experience when shopping.
As far as I seeing, they did something similar to others.
Respect yourself and don't go to this store with awful quality and shameful policy!

text.text:
Very Rude and discriminating. When I approached 1 female for assistance, she replied rudely "NO ENGLISH"!! And looked away. No attempt to assist. Another male staff doesn't know his product replied, "I don't know, don't ask me".. These staff need retraining.

To be fair, some staff were very helpful. Extreme service.

text.text:
A decent variety of clothing at cheap prices. But the durability of some of the clothing options is questionable. The store is usually crowded, but there are a lot of checkout counters.
The menswear section has a lot of casual wear and almost no formal clothing options. Wish there were more choices in the menswear section.

text.text: What a beautiful chatedral this is. An absolute must see when you are in Milan. Definitely go see the rooftop terrace. Take the stairs if you can. The sensation is magnificient.

text.text: Absolutely filthy with urine on the stairs and homeless remains, at least the exit view was nice. The reviews are only good because people thought they were for the cathedral not for the metro station.

text.text: A beautiful gothic cathedral. Amazing attention to detail both inside and out. The trip to the roof was fantastic. The museum and ruins under the cathedral were interesting too. Well worth the combined ticket price. Just scan a QR code whilst queuing to purchase. Very straightforward.

name: places/ChIJH05-WBHuhkcRNjexLI56Nhs

plusCode.compoundCode: F5CQ+Q4 Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

adrFormatAddress: Via Brera, 28, 20121 Milano MI, Italy

editorialSummary.text: Graceful palazzo used by Napoleon, with medieval and Renaissance art especially from Northern Italy.

text.text: One of the best collections of artwork you will ever see, this collection is up there with the Uffizi art gallery. It has an absolutely incredible collection of paintings, statues, sculptures and jewelry. It’s also located in a very unique building with amazing architecture. I would definitely recommend checking out this museum.

originalText.text: One of the best collections of artwork you will ever see, this collection is up there with the Uffizi art gallery. It has an absolutely incredible collection of paintings, statues, sculptures and jewelry. It’s also located in a very unique building with amazing architecture. I would definitely recommend checking out this museum.

text.text: They have some absolutely amazing paintings here. If you're interested in art, you should not miss this museum.

originalText.text: They have some absolutely amazing paintings here. If you're interested in art, you should not miss this museum.

text.text: Amazing experience. The public gallery in a beautiful classical building. Great exposition and collection of the painting. The paintings were mostly religious themed. We bought tickets online, and entrance was without waiting.

originalText.text: Amazing experience. The public gallery in a beautiful classical building. Great exposition and collection of the painting. The paintings were mostly religious themed. We bought tickets online, and entrance was without waiting.

text.text: The Pinacoteca di Brera in Milan is a magnificent showcase of European art, particularly strong in Italian paintings. The gallery, housed in a historic 17th-century building, offers a journey through centuries of artistic genius. Notable for its collection of Italian Renaissance art, it features masterpieces by Caravaggio, Raphael, and Tintoretto. Each room is thoughtfully curated, providing context and insight into the evolution of artistic styles. The ambiance is serene, ideal for contemplation. A must-visit for art enthusiasts, it offers a deep, enriching experience that captures the essence of Italy's rich artistic heritage.

originalText.text: The Pinacoteca di Brera in Milan is a magnificent showcase of European art, particularly strong in Italian paintings. Each room is thoughtfully curated, providing context and insight into the evolution of artistic styles. The ambiance is serene, ideal for contemplation. A must-visit for art enthusiasts, it offers a deep, enriching experience that captures the essence of Italy's rich artistic heritage.

text.text:
IMPORTANT POINTS:
* It is worth getting an audioguide.
* Remember to take a picture map of this place before you drive in.
* If you do not have time focus on paintings with an audio guide number or description with white boards.

name: places/ChIJw7aG_QY1eUcRFtQJWKmcCyc
formattedAddress: P.za del Duomo, 20123 Milano MI, Italy

plusCode.compoundCode: F58Q+8X Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

adrFormatAddress: P.za del Duomo, 20123 Milano MI, Italy
shortFormattedAddress: Town House Galleria, P.za del Duomo, Milano

editorialSummary.text: Mall housed in a glass-covered 19th-century arcade with luxury clothing brands & upscale dining.

text.text:
Our family recently explored the Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II, and the experience was nothing short of stunning.
The architecture of the Galleria is awe-inspiring, with its elegant design and intricate detailing. Walking through the historic passageways, we felt transported to a bygone era of grandeur and sophistication. The kids were fascinated by the intricate mosaics, high glass ceilings, and the general sense of opulence that permeated the surroundings.
However, for a family on a budget, the allure of the luxury shops and designer boutiques was bittersweet. While window shopping was enjoyable, the reality was that most of the items on display were way beyond our financial reach. It's essential for families to be aware that this is more of an experience destination than a budget-friendly shopping spot.
On a positive note, the atmosphere was vibrant, and the Galleria is not just about shopping. We took a moment to enjoy a coffee in one of the historic cafes, soaking in the ambiance and people-watching, which added a pleasant touch to our visit.
In summary, Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II is a must-visit for its architectural marvel and historical significance. Families should approach it with the understanding that the shopping experience might be more aspirational than practical, but the overall ambiance and cultural richness make it a worthwhile stop, even if you're not planning to splurge on designer goods.

text.text: The Galleria is stunning & filled with high end, beautiful stores. The ceiling will take your breath away, but don't forget to look at the floor... it's equally lovely.

text.text: The building itself is gorgeous and mesmerizing. We had a good time walking around. It’s also fun to look around the luxury stores but other than that there isn’t much to do or look at. It’s also extremely crowded to the point that it gets difficult to walk.

text.text:
Not sure how to describe this place correctly. Shopping center with the most famous brands. Most people visit it just to take a look and make a photo.
It makes sense to visit just to close point "to see the most famous shopping gallery in Europe". In general, nothing special.
Nice stationary shop with a some unique souvenirs.

text.text: I visited a splendid place where the past and present, everyday life and luxury, beautifully intermingle among the places I've been to shop. The coexistence of Prada's past and present was particularly fascinating. Moreover, the sight of Gucci's extravagant Christmas tree in front of the Prada store felt like a challenge to competing brands, adding an intriguing touch. I look forward to enjoying this place more leisurely on my next visit.
